title: KPN to invest 5 billion euros at home by 2030, increase dividends
description: (Reuters) -Dutch telecoms group KPN said on Wednesday it planned to invest more than 5 billion euros ($5.83 billion) in its home country through 2030, focusing on fibre optic networks, 5G, artificial intelligence and cybersecurity.
content:
(Reuters) -Dutch telecoms group KPN said on Wednesday it planned to invest more than 5 billion euros ($5.83 billion) in its home country through 2030, focusing on fibre optic networks, 5G, artificial intelligence and cybersecurity.

title: Global stock rout deepens as $500bn wiped off AI chip makers
description: The global rout in stock markets deepened overnight as more than $500bn (£384bn) was wiped off the value of artificial intelligence (AI) chip makers.
content:
The UK’s stock market is on track to fall at the open amid the global sell-off in stocks.
The FTSE 100 was down 0.2pc in premarket trading, declining much less than other indexes due to its low exposure to tech stocks.

title: Perplexity shopping bot not welcome at Amazon shop
description: Amazon is demanding that artificial intelligence startup Perplexity put a stop to its bot shopping for people at the e-commerce giant's retail platform, the companies said on Nov 4.
content:
SAN FRANCISCO: Amazon is demanding that artificial intelligence startup Perplexity put a stop to its bot shopping for people at the e-commerce giant's retail platform, the companies said on Nov 4.

title: Kim Kardashian Blames ‘Toxic Friend’ ChatGPT For Failing Her Law Exam
description: Media personality Kim Kardashian has opened up about her experience with using the popular artificial intelligence tool - ChatGPT. In a recent interview, Kardashian blamed the chatbot for failing in her law exams. While participating in Vanity Fair’s popular ‘lie detector’ test show, Kardashian revealed that the AI tool gave her wrong answers while she was studying. The video interview was published on Nov. 3.
content: Media personality and entrepreneur Kim Kardashian has opened up about her experience with the popular artificial intelligence tool ChatGPT, joking in a recent interview that the chatbot made her law studies more difficult by giving her incorrect answ... [1888 chars]

title: As AI Makes Human Labour Obsolete, India May Emerge As The World’s Moral And Consciousness Leader: Report
description: Macrohistorian Lawrence Taub predicted that around mid-century, automation, artificial intelligence and "free energy" would make the ‘Worker Age’ obsolete, forcing societies to confront a vacuum of identity.
content: New Delhi: When machines or artificial intelligence (AI) replace human effort, humanity would be forced inward, seeking meaning rather than material survival, and in that world, India -- not China or the West -- could emerge as the most influential c... [2092 chars]

title: Coca-Cola Faces Fresh Criticism Over AI-Generated Christmas Ad Campaign
description: Coca-Cola’s latest Christmas campaign has sparked backlash on social media after the company once again opted for artificial intelligence to design its festive commercial. The “Holidays Are Coming” ad campaign, released on Nov. 3, features a 60-second film showing Santa opening a bottle of Coca-Cola before a fleet of the brand’s iconic red trucks travels through a snowy landscape. Along the route, animated animals, including polar bears, penguins, puppies and rabbits, pause to watch them pass.
content:
Coca-Cola’s latest Christmas campaign has sparked backlash on social media after the company once again opted for artificial intelligence to design its festive commercial.

title: India's Own AI Revolution: Atomesus AI Set to Launch Soon
description: New Delhi [India], November 5: In a historic step for India's growing artificial-intelligence ecosystem, Atomesus AI, developed under the leadership of Indus Valley Group, is gearing up for its official launch. The initiative, led by a group of passionate college innovators with research exposure to ISRO-linked projects, aims to make artificial intelligence accessible, affordable, and proudly Indian.

title: IBM to cut thousands of jobs as it doubles down on AI, software and cloud growth push
description: IBM will reduce a small percentage of its global workforce in the fourth quarter, part of a broader strategic shift toward expanding its AI, software, and cloud offerings. The move reflects ongoing changes in the tech industry, with other major companies like Amazon and Microsoft also enacting layoffs. IBM employs approximately 270,000 people worldwide, and a 1% reduction could mean nearly 2,700 job losses. The company expects U.S. employment to remain flat year over year despite some domestic roles being impacted. These changes come as IBM reports stronger software revenue and adapts to advances in artificial intelligence.
content: IBM is preparing to lay off thousands of employees worldwide in the fourth quarter of 2025, as the company is focusing on sharpening its focus on artificial intelligence, software, and cloud services. The decision reportedly comes amid a wave of tech... [2615 chars]
